headline: NIKE, Inc. Declares $0.41 Quarterly Dividend
summary: BEAVERTON, Ore., November 20, 2025--NIKE, Inc. (NYSE: NKE) announced today that its Board of Directors has declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.41 per share on the Company’s outstanding Class A and Class B Common Stock payable on January 2, 2026, to shareholders of record at the close of business on December 1, 2025. This represents an increase of 3 percent versus the prior quarterly dividend rate of $0.40 per share. Today’s announcement marks the 24th consecutive year that NIKE has increase

headline: Macy's stock sees big gains in 2025: A closer look at the retailer
summary: Macy's (M) stock is up by over 60% over the last six months. Just what exactly is the retailer doing right in a tight consumer landscape, especially ahead of the start of the holiday shopping season? Bianco Research President Jim Bianco, Great Hill Capital chairman and managing member Thomas Hayes, and Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma discuss Macy's execution of its turnaround plan. Macy's is scheduled to report third quarter earnings on Wednesday, December 3. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: E-Commerce Today - WeShop Redefines Retail with U.S. Social Commerce Expansion
summary: WeShop, a pioneering social commerce platform, has entered the U.S. market following a successful debut on the Nasdaq. The company's app allows users to earn ownership in the platform through their purchases and referrals, transforming the traditional shopping experience with its ShareBack™ program. With partnerships including major brands like Bloomingdales, Walmart, and Nike, WeShop enables users to explore over 1 billion products while earning WePoints that can be converted into equity...

headline: Does the Recent 15% Drop Signal a New Opportunity for NIKE Stock in 2025?
summary: Wondering if NIKE’s current share price is a golden opportunity or just a mirage? You’re not alone, especially as the stock’s valuation signals have caught the attention of many investors lately. NIKE’s stock has seen a notable decline, dropping 2.4% over the past week and a sharper 15.0% since the start of the year. This has stirred up lots of conversations about growth potential and risk. Recent headlines have spotlighted broader challenges for consumer and athletic brands, including...

headline: NIKE (NKE): What Recent Stock Movement Signals for Its Valuation
summary: NIKE (NKE) shares are showing movement this week, prompting investors to review the company’s recent momentum and financials. Over the past month, NIKE stock has slipped 7%, and longer-term returns have moderated as well. See our latest analysis for NIKE. NIKE’s share price momentum has clearly faded, dropping 7.4% over the past month and now sitting near $62.64.
